brief_summary.textblock: Phase I-II Clinical Trial - Safety and efficacy of umbilical-cord-derived mesenchymal stem cell (UC-MSC) in patients with Acute Lung Injury ,open label, controlled prospective study.

detailed_description.textblock:
Phase I-II Clinical Trial - Safety and efficacy of umbilical-cord-derived mesenchymal stem cell (UC-MSC) in patients with acute lung injury,open label, controlled prospective study.
Every patient will maintain their standard treatment of acute lung injury, with maximum tolerated dosage without side effects.
The day of infusion will be considered day zero. From that moment, followup will be divided into 2,7,14 days.
Clinical results will be analyzed after completion of 14 days of followup.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety will be determined by the assessment of major adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: From day 0 at the start of treatment to day 14.
primary_outcome.description: Safety will be determined by the assessment of major adverse events defined as death, and the incidence of prespecified infusion-associated events and non-serious adverse events thought to be related to the MSC infusion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantify pulmonary respiratory function measured by chest computerized tomography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital,2 day post-infusion, and days 7,14.

secondary_outcome.measure: The efficacy of UC-MSC treatment was measured by arterial blood gas analysis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital,2 day post-infusion, and days 7,14.

secondary_outcome.measure: The efficacy of UC-MSC treatment was measured by biological markers,including markers of inflammation，IL-6
The efficacy of UC-MSC treatment was measured by biological markers,including markers of inflammation，IL-8

arm_group.description: Human umbilical cord MSCs are administrated to patients by intravenous infusion

intervention.description: Human umbilical cord MSCs are transplanted by intravenous infusion(5×10^5/kg) once a day,a total of three times.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed informed consent
- Age between 35 and 70 y
- Acute onset within 7 days.
- Oxygenation index:200＜PaO2/FiO2≤300mmHg; alveolar-arterial oxygen differences:P(A-a)O2>35mmHg
- Bilateral infiltrates on chest radiography
- No cardiac failure
Exclusion Criteria:
- Declined to sign informed consent
- Socially and mentally disabilities
- Malignant diseases
- Combined with severe infectious diseases
- Patients with positive blood tests for Hepatitis B or Hepatitis C or HIV or tuberculosis at the time of screening
- Pregnant or perinatal women
- Severe diseases of any major organs
